variable_information.variable_description: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in the United States. At the top of the ladder are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respectable jobs. The bottom are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, least education, and the least respected jobs or no job

variable.variable_name: Body mass index (BMI)

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :bmi: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Diastolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting diastolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :dbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Systolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting systolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :sbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 3% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction with >= 4% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (alternative) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index: Number of arousals per hour of sleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :ai_all: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Study scored sleep/wake rather than with full sleep staging if there is not sufficient quality on EEG lead. Studies scored as sleep wake have all sleep stages scored using a default of Stage 2 and no arousals are scored.

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slewake: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Total Sleep Duration: the interval between sleep onset and sleep offset while the participant is asleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Conventionally, this would be called total sleep time (TST) (i.e. total time spent in stage 1 or greater).

Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slpprdp: at Visit 5

Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp3 + hrop3 + hnrbp3 + hnrop3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp3 + urop3 + unrbp3 + unrop3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset]( https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_recommended)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hremba3 + hroa3 + hnrba3 + hnroa3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbpa3 + uropa3 + unrbpa3 + unropa3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (recommended) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal and hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal)/ hours of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events during REM sleep
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp3 + hrop3 + carbp3 + carop3 + oarbp3 + oarop3 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (recommended) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/numom2b/variables?search=aasm15_acceptable)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp4 + hrop4 + carbp4 + carop4 + oarbp4 + oarop4 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Body mass index (BMI)

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :bmi: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Diastolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting diastolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :dbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Systolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting systolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :sbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 3% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction with >= 4% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (alternative) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index: Number of arousals per hour of sleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :ai_all: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Study scored sleep/wake rather than with full sleep staging if there is not sufficient quality on EEG lead. Studies scored as sleep wake have all sleep stages scored using a default of Stage 2 and no arousals are scored.

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slewake: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Total Sleep Duration: the interval between sleep onset and sleep offset while the participant is asleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Conventionally, this would be called total sleep time (TST) (i.e. total time spent in stage 1 or greater).

Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slpprdp: at Visit 5

Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp3 + hrop3 + hnrbp3 + hnrop3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp3 + urop3 + unrbp3 + unrop3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset]( https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_recommended)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hremba3 + hroa3 + hnrba3 + hnroa3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbpa3 + uropa3 + unrbpa3 + unropa3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (recommended) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_acceptable)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp4 + hrop4 + hnrbp4 + hnrop4 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp4 + urop4 + unrbp4 + unrop4) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with no oxygen desaturation used and with or without arousal / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp + hrop + hnrbp + hnrop + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop ) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index: (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used only with arousal + hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with no oxygen desaturation used only with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hremba + hroa + hnrba + hnroa + carba + caroa + canba + canoa + oarba + oaroa + oanba + oanoa ) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (Non-Supine) : Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with no oxygen desaturation used and with or without arousal / hour of sleep in non-supine position    from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrop + hnrop + carop + canop + oarop + oanop ) / ( remepop + nremepop )

Item from the Epworth Sleepiness Scale [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888)

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=epworth)

variable.variable_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Total score

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=epworth)
variable_information.calculation: essq1 + essq2 + essq3 + essq4 + essq5 + essq6 + essq7 + essq8

Child Health Questionnaire Parent Form 50 Questions: Behavior subscore (0-100)

variable_information.variable_description:
The subscale score is based on 6 items from the Child Health Questionnaire Parent Form 50 Questions. A high score suggests fewer behavior problems. [Asmussen L et al., 2000 (PubMed ID: 11029320)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11029320/)

variable.variable_name: Body mass index (BMI)

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :bmi: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Diastolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting diastolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :dbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Systolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting systolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :sbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 3% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction with >= 4% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (alternative) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index: Number of arousals per hour of sleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :ai_all: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Study scored sleep/wake rather than with full sleep staging if there is not sufficient quality on EEG lead. Studies scored as sleep wake have all sleep stages scored using a default of Stage 2 and no arousals are scored.

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slewake: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Total Sleep Duration: the interval between sleep onset and sleep offset while the participant is asleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Conventionally, this would be called total sleep time (TST) (i.e. total time spent in stage 1 or greater).

Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slpprdp: at Visit 5

Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp3 + hrop3 + hnrbp3 + hnrop3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp3 + urop3 + unrbp3 + unrop3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset]( https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_recommended)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hremba3 + hroa3 + hnrba3 + hnroa3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbpa3 + uropa3 + unrbpa3 + unropa3) / slpprdp

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset]( https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_recommended)

variable.variable_name: PSG Quality Assessment: Arousals unreliable (REM)

variable_information.variable_description: Due to signal problems, scorer was unable to reliably assess arousals in stage REM.  The scoring of arousals in stage REM was determined to be unreliable.

variable_information.variable_description: Scorer noted that there was a problem differentiating REM  and non-REM sleep.

variable.variable_name: PSG Quality Assessment: Respiratory scoring problems

variable_information.variable_description: Due to signal problems, scorer noted that there was a problem scoring respiratory events.

variable.variable_name: PSG Quality Assessment: Sleep Wake Scoring

variable_information.variable_description: Study was scored sleep/wake rathen than with full sleep staging.  This assessment is made by the scorer if there is not sufficient quality on EEG leads to do full R&K scoring.  (0=no (full scoring); 1=yes (sleep/wake only))

variable.variable_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Total score

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=epworth)
variable_information.calculation: essq1 + essq2 + essq3 + essq4 + essq5 + essq6 + essq7 + essq8

variable.variable_name: Body mass index (BMI)

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :bmi: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Diastolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting diastolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :dbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Systolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting systolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :sbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 3% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction with >= 4% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (alternative) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index: Number of arousals per hour of sleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :ai_all: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Study scored sleep/wake rather than with full sleep staging if there is not sufficient quality on EEG lead. Studies scored as sleep wake have all sleep stages scored using a default of Stage 2 and no arousals are scored.

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slewake: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Total Sleep Duration: the interval between sleep onset and sleep offset while the participant is asleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Conventionally, this would be called total sleep time (TST) (i.e. total time spent in stage 1 or greater).

Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slpprdp: at Visit 5

Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp3 + hrop3 + hnrbp3 + hnrop3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp3 + urop3 + unrbp3 + unrop3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp + hrop + carbp + carop + oarbp + oarop ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with >= 2% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 2% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp2 + hrop2 + carbp2 + carop2 + oarbp2 + oarop2 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal and hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with >= 3% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal)/ hours of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events during REM sleep
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp3 + hrop3 + carbp3 + carop3 + oarbp3 + oarop3 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 4% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (recommended) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/numom2b/variables?search=aasm15_acceptable)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp4 + hrop4 + carbp4 + carop4 + oarbp4 + oarop4 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (REM): (Apneas with >= 5% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 5% oxygen desaturation and with or without arousal) / hour of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( hrembp5 + hrop5 + carbp5 + carop5 + oarbp5 + oarop5 ) / minremp

variable.variable_name: Hypopnea Index (REM, Non-Supine) : (Hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with no oxygen desaturation threshold used only with arousal) / hour of REM sleep in non-supine position from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.

variable.variable_name: Hypopnea Index (REM, Non-Supine): (Hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and with >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of REM sleep in non-supine position from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

variable_information.variable_description: Total number of arousals per hour of sleep.  Ratio of count of arousals to total sleep time in hours.

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index (NREM): number of arousals per hour of NREM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.calculation: 60 * ( arnrembp + arnremop ) / ( slpprdp - minremp )

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index (REM): number of arousals per hour of REM sleep from type I polysomnography

variable.variable_name: Body mass index (BMI)

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :bmi: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Diastolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting diastolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :dbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Systolic blood pressure

variable_information.variable_description:
Average resting systolic blood pressure of two measurements collected from the upper arm in a single clinic visit. When more than two measurements were collected, the average was calculated using the second and third measurements. In cases where either of the measurements was missing, the average was calculated discarding the missing value.

Harmonized by the NSRR team to align with TOPMed and BioDataCatalyst standards. Source: :sbp: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 3% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h3: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >= 4% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4a: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (All apneas + hypopneas with >=30% nasal cannula [or alternative sensor] reduction with >= 4% oxygen desaturation) / hour of sleep

variable_information.variable_description:
Harmonized by the NSRR team.

The definition of hypopnea events is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) AASM 2012 update (alternative) [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) AASM 2015 (acceptable) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.].

Refer to the source for detailed definition for respiratory events: :ahi_a0h4: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Arousal Index: Number of arousals per hour of sleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :ai_all: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Study scored sleep/wake rather than with full sleep staging if there is not sufficient quality on EEG lead. Studies scored as sleep wake have all sleep stages scored using a default of Stage 2 and no arousals are scored.

variable_information.variable_description: Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slewake: at Visit 5

variable.variable_name: Total Sleep Duration: the interval between sleep onset and sleep offset while the participant is asleep from polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Conventionally, this would be called total sleep time (TST) (i.e. total time spent in stage 1 or greater).

Harmonized by the NSRR team. Source: :slpprdp: at Visit 5

variable_information.variable_description: Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events.
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hrembp3 + hrop3 + hnrbp3 + hnrop3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbp3 + urop3 + unrbp3 + unrop3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Apnea-Hypopnea Index : (Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used and with or without arousal+ hypopneas with > 30% flow reduction and >= 3% oxygen desaturation or with arousal) / hour of sleep from type I polysomnography

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Summary metric of sleep disordered breathing events. The definition for hypopneas is consistent with the following clinical guidelines: (1) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2007 Manual (2012 update) (recommended). [Berry RB et al. 2012 (PubMed ID:23066376)] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23066376), and (2) American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) 2015 (recommended) [Berry RB et al. The AASM Manual for the Scoring of Sleep and Associated Events: Rules, Terminology and Technical Specifications, Version 2.2. American Academy of Sleep Medicine, Darien, IL, 2015.]

[Search for all AHI variables consistent with the same clinical guidelines within this dataset]( https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=aasm15_recommended)
variable_information.calculation: 60 * (hremba3 + hroa3 + hnrba3 + hnroa3 + carbp + carop + canbp + canop + oarbp + oarop + oanbp + oanop + urbpa3 + uropa3 + unrbpa3 + unropa3) / slpprdp

variable.variable_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Total score

variable_information.variable_description:
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/cfs/variables?search=epworth)
variable_information.calculation: essq1 + essq2 + essq3 + essq4 + essq5 + essq6 + essq7 + essq8
